snippet: Reports said a ferry accident claimed the lives of more than 200 people who were trying to escape a rebel advance on Malakal, the capital of the oil-rich state of Upper Nile.
abstract: Over 200 people fleeing violence in Malakal, South Sudan, are killed when ferry carrying them to safety sinks in White Nile River; accident is worst reported of several boat mishaps during month's fighting.
lead_paragraph: Reports said a ferry accident claimed the lives of more than 200 people who were trying to escape a rebel advance on Malakal, the capital of the oil-rich state of Upper Nile.

headline.main: Scores Die in Ferry Accident as They Flee Violence in South Sudan
headline.print_headline: Scores Die in Ferry Accident as They Flee Violence in South Sudan
